summary: The 'Advanced Border Coordination Act of 2025' mandates the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to establish at least two Joint Operations Centers along the southern U.S. border. These centers will serve as hubs for coordinating operations between federal, state, local, and tribal agencies. The centers will handle coordination and communication for field operations, border security, criminal activity deterrence, and information sharing. The Secretary of Homeland Security is responsible for annual reports to Congress, including assessments of the centers' effectiveness and recommendations for improvements. The bill focuses on collaboration in line with the purposes described.
